in_intervals.description:
Calling intervals. File with intervals that should be considered for variant calling. 
 This file can be obtained from BED file using GATK BedToIntervalList. For a list of files, provide a comma separated values of paths.

in_alignments.description: Input alignments. BAM/SAM/CRAM file containing reads this argument must be specified at least once. For a list of files, provide a comma separated values of paths.

alleles.description: The set of alleles at which to genotype when --genotyping_mode is GENOTYPE_GIVEN_ALLELES.

comp.description: Comparison vcf file(s). If a call overlaps with a record from the provided comp track, the INFO field will be annotated as such in the output with the track name. Records that are filtered in the comp track will be ignored. Note that 'dbSNP' has been special-cased (see the --dbsnp)

contamination_fraction_per_sample_file.description: Tab-separated file containing fraction of contamination in sequencing data (per sample) to aggressively remove. Format should be "<SampleID><TAB><Contamination>" (Contamination is double) per line; No header.

sequence_dictionary.description: Use the given sequence dictionary as the master/canonical sequence dictionary. Must be a .dict file.

sequence_dictionary_merge.description: The index sequence dictionary to use instead of the sequence dictionary in the input files.

second_input.description: Second set of intervals for SUBTRACT and DIFFERENCE operations. This argument may be specified 0 or more times.

population_callset.description: Callset to use in calculating genotype priors.

exclude_intervals_file.description: One or more genomic intervals to exclude from processing.

active_probability_threshold.description: Minimum probability for a locus to be considered active.

activity_profile_out.description: Output the raw activity profile results in IGV format.

adaptive_pruning.description: Use Mutect2's adaptive graph pruning algorithm.

adaptive_pruning_initial_error_rate.description: Initial base error rate estimate for adaptive pruning.

add_output_sam_program_record.description: If true, adds a PG tag to created SAM/BAM/CRAM files.

add_output_vcf_command_line.description: If true, adds a command line header line to created VCF files.

all_site_pls.description: Advanced, experimental argument: if SNP likelihood model is specified, and if EMIT_ALL_SITES output mode is set, when we set this argument then we will also emit PLs at all sites. This will give a measure of reference confidence and a measure of which alt alleles are more plausible (if any). WARNINGS: - This feature will inflate VCF file size considerably. - All SNP ALT alleles will be emitted with corresponding 10 PL values. - An error will be emitted if EMIT_ALL_SITES is not set, or if anything other than diploid SNP model is used

annotate_with_num_discovered_alleles.description: If provided, we will annotate records with the number of alternate alleles that were discovered (but not necessarily genotyped) at a given site.

annotation.description: One or more specific annotations to add to variant calls. This argument may be specified 0 or more times. Please provide the values as a comma-separated from this AlleleFraction,AS_BaseQualityRankSumTest,AS_FisherStrand,AS_InbreedingCoeff,AS_MappingQualityRankSumTest,AS_QualByDepth,AS_ReadPosRankSumTest,AS_RMSMappingQuality,AS_StrandOddsRatio,BaseQuality,BaseQualityRankSumTest,ChromosomeCounts,ClippingRankSumTest,CountNs,Coverage,DepthPerAlleleBySample,DepthPerSampleHC,ExcessHet,FisherStrand,FragmentLength,GenotypeSummaries,InbreedingCoeff,LikelihoodRankSumTest,MappingQuality,MappingQualityRankSumTest,MappingQualityZero,OriginalAlignment,OxoGReadCounts,PolymorphicNuMT,PossibleDeNovo,QualByDepth,ReadOrientationArtifact,ReadPosition,ReadPosRankSumTest,ReferenceBases,RMSMappingQuality,SampleList,StrandArtifact,StrandBiasBySample,StrandOddsRatio,TandemRepeat,UniqueAltReadCount.

annotation_group.description: One or more groups of annotations to apply to variant calls. This argument may be specified 0 or more times. AS_StandardAnnotation,OrientationBiasMixtureModelAnnotation,ReducibleAnnotation,StandardAnnotation,StandardHCAnnotation,StandardMutectAnnotation, Please select values from the following list and provide them as a comma-separated string.

annotations_to_exclude.description: One or more specific annotations to exclude from variant calls. This argument may be specified 0 or more times. Which annotations to exclude from output in the variant calls. Note that this argument has higher priority than the -A or -G arguments, so these annotations will be excluded even if they are explicitly included with the other options. Please provide values as a comma-separated list using only the following terms: BaseQualityRankSumTest, ChromosomeCounts, Coverage, DepthPerAlleleBySample, DepthPerSampleHC, ExcessHet, FisherStrand, InbreedingCoeff, MappingQualityRankSumTest, QualByDepth, ReadPosRankSumTest, RMSMappingQuality, StrandOddsRatio.

assembly_region_out.description: Output the assembly region to this IGV formatted file.

assembly_region_padding.description: Number of additional bases of context to include around each assembly region.

bam_output.description: File to which assembled haplotypes should be written.

bam_writer_type.description: Which haplotypes should be written to the BAM.

base_quality_score_threshold.description: Base qualities below this threshold will be reduced to the minimum (6).

contamination_fraction_to_filter.description: Fraction of contamination in sequencing data (for all samples) to aggressively remove.

create_output_bam_index.description: If true, create a BAM/CRAM index when writing a coordinate-sorted BAM/CRAM file.

create_output_variant_index.description: If true, create a VCF index when writing a coordinate-sorted VCF file.

debug.description: Print out very verbose debug information about each triggering active region.

disable_bam_index_caching.description: If true, don't cache BAM indexes, this will reduce memory requirements but may harm performance if many intervals are specified. Caching is automatically disabled if there are no intervals specified.

disable_optimizations.description: Don't skip calculations in active regions with no variants.

disable_read_filter.description: Read filters to be disabled before analysis. This argument may be specified 0 or more times. Please provide values as a comma-separated list using only the following terms: GoodCigarReadFilter, MappedReadFilter, MappingQualityAvailableReadFilter, MappingQualityReadFilter, NonZeroReferenceLengthAlignmentReadFilter, NotDuplicateReadFilter, NotSecondaryAlignmentReadFilter, PassesVendorQualityCheckReadFilter, WellformedReadFilter.

disable_sequence_dictionary_validation.description: If specified, do not check the sequence dictionaries from our inputs for compatibility. Use at your own risk!

disable_tool_default_read_filters.description: Disable all tool default read filters (warning: many tools will not function correctly without their default read filters on).

dont_increase_kmer_sizes_for_cycles.description: Disable iterating over kmer sizes when graph cycles are detected.

dont_trim_active_regions.description: If specified, we will not trim down the active region from the full region (active + extension) to just the active interval for genotyping.

dont_use_soft_clipped_bases.description: Do not analyze soft clipped bases in the reads.

emit_ref_confidence.description: Mode for emitting reference confidence scores.

enable_all_annotations.description: Use all possible annotations (not for the faint of heart).

exclude_intervals_string.description: One or more genomic intervals to exclude from processing. This argument may be specified 0 or more times. Please provide values as a comma-separated.

founder_id.description: Samples representing the population \"founders\".  This argument may be specified 0 or more times. Please provide values as a comma-separated.

genotype_filtered_alleles.description: Whether to genotype all given alleles, even filtered ones, --genotyping_mode is GENOTYPE_GIVEN_ALLELES.

genotyping_mode.description: Specifies how to determine the alternate alleles to use for genotyping.

graph_output.description: Write debug assembly graph information to this file.

gvcf_gq_bands.description: Exclusive upper bounds for reference confidence GQ bands (must be in [1, 100] and specified in increasing order). This argument may be specified 0 or more times. Please provide values as a comma-separated.

heterozygosity.description: Heterozygosity value used to compute prior likelihoods for any locus. See the GATKDocs for full details on the meaning of this population genetics concept.

heterozygosity_stdev.description: Standard deviation of heterozygosity for SNP and indel calling.

indel_heterozygosity.description: Heterozygosity for indel calling. See the GATKDocs for heterozygosity for full details on the meaning of this population genetics concept.

indel_size_to_eliminate_in_ref_model.description: The size of an indel to check for in the reference model.

input_prior.description: Input prior for calls. This argument may be specified 0 or more times.

interval_exclusion_padding.description: Amount of padding (in bp) to add to each interval you are excluding.

interval_merging_rule.description: Interval merging rule for abutting intervals.

interval_padding.description: Amount of padding (in bp) to add to each interval you are including.

include_intervals_string.description: One or more genomic intervals over which to operate. This argument may be specified 0 or more times. Please provide values as a comma-separated.

interval_set_rule.description: Set merging approach to use for combining interval inputs.

kmer_size.description: Kmer size to use in the read threading assembler. This argument may be specified 0 or more times.

max_alternate_alleles.description: Maximum number of alternate alleles to genotype.

max_assembly_region_size.description: Maximum size of an assembly region.

max_genotype_count.description: Maximum number of genotypes to consider at any site.

max_mnp_distance.description: Two or more phased substitutions separated by this distance or less are merged into MNPs. Warning: when used in GVCF mode, resulting GVCFs cannot be joint-genotyped.

max_num_haplotypes_in_population.description: Maximum number of haplotypes to consider for your population.

max_prob_propagation_distance.description: Upper limit on how many bases away probability mass can be moved around when calculating the boundaries between active and inactive assembly regions.

max_reads_per_alignment_start.description: Maximum number of reads to retain per alignment start position. Reads above this threshold will be downsampled. Set to 0 to disable.

max_unpruned_variants.description: Maximum number of variants in graph the adaptive pruner will allow.

maximum_mapping_quality.description: Valid only if \"MappingQualityReadFilter\" is specified:\nMaximum mapping quality to keep (inclusive).

mem_overhead_per_job.description: It allows a user to set the desired overhead memory (in MB) when running a tool or adding it to a workflow.

mem_per_job.description: It allows a user to set the desired memory requirement (in MB) when running a tool or adding it to a workflow.

min_assembly_region_size.description: Minimum size of an assembly region.

min_base_quality_score.description: Minimum base quality required to consider a base for calling.

min_dangling_branch_length.description: Minimum length of a dangling branch to attempt recovery.

min_pruning.description: Minimum support to not prune paths in the graph.

minimum_mapping_quality.description: Valid only if \"MappingQualityReadFilter\" is specified:\nMinimum mapping quality to keep (inclusive).

native_pair_hmm_threads.description: How many threads should a native pairHMM implementation use.

native_pair_hmm_use_double_precision.description: Use double precision in the native pairHMM. This is slower but matches the java implementation better.

num_pruning_samples.description: Number of samples that must pass the minPruning threshold.

num_reference_samples_if_no_call.description: Number of hom-ref genotypes to infer at sites not present in a panel.

output_mode.description: Specifies which type of calls we should output.

pair_hmm_gap_continuation_penalty.description: Flat gap continuation penalty for use in the pairHMM.

pair_hmm_implementation.description: The pairHMM implementation to use for genotype likelihood calculations.

pcr_indel_model.description: The PCR indel model to use.

phred_scaled_global_read_mismapping_rate.description: The global assumed mismapping rate for reads.

pruning_lod_threshold.description: Log-10 likelihood ratio threshold for adaptive pruning algorithm.

read_filter.description: Read filters to be applied before analysis. This argument may be specified 0 or more times. Please provide the values as a comma-separated from this AlignmentAgreesWithHeaderReadFilter,AllowAllReadsReadFilter,AmbiguousBaseReadFilter,CigarContainsNoNOperator,FirstOfPairReadFilter,FragmentLengthReadFilter,GoodCigarReadFilter,HasReadGroupReadFilter,LibraryReadFilter,MappedReadFilter,MappingQualityAvailableReadFilter,MappingQualityNotZeroReadFilter,MappingQualityReadFilter,MatchingBasesAndQualsReadFilter,MateDifferentStrandReadFilter,MateOnSameContigOrNoMappedMateReadFilter,MetricsReadFilter,NonChimericOriginalAlignmentReadFilter,NonZeroFragmentLengthReadFilter,NonZeroReferenceLengthAlignmentReadFilter,NotDuplicateReadFilter,NotOpticalDuplicateReadFilter,NotSecondaryAlignmentReadFilter,NotSupplementaryAlignmentReadFilter,OverclippedReadFilter,PairedReadFilter,PassesVendorQualityCheckReadFilter,PlatformReadFilter,PlatformUnitReadFilter,PrimaryLineReadFilter,ProperlyPairedReadFilter,ReadGroupBlackListReadFilter,ReadGroupReadFilter,ReadLengthEqualsCigarLengthReadFilter,ReadLengthReadFilter,ReadNameReadFilter,ReadStrandFilter,SampleReadFilter,SecondOfPairReadFilter,SeqIsStoredReadFilter,ValidAlignmentEndReadFilter,ValidAlignmentStartReadFilter and WellformedReadFilter.

read_validation_stringency.description: Validation stringency for all SAM/BAM/CRAM/SRA files read by this program. The default stringency value silent can improve performance when processing a bam file in which variable-length data (read, qualities, tags) do not otherwise need to be decoded.

sample_name.description: Name of single sample to use from a multi-sample bam.

sample_ploidy.description: Ploidy (number of chromosomes) per sample. For pooled data, set to (number of samples in each pool x Sample Ploidy).

sites_only_vcf_output.description: If true, don't emit genotype fields when writing VCF file output.

smith_waterman.description: Which Smith-Waterman implementation to use, generally FASTEST_AVAILABLE is the right choice.

standard_min_confidence_threshold_for_ca.description: The minimum phred-scaled confidence threshold at which variants should be called. When HaplotypeCaller is used in GVCF mode (using either -ERC GVCF or -ERC BP_RESOLUTION) the call threshold is automatically set to zero. Call confidence thresholding will then be performed in the subsequent GenotypeGVCFs command.

use_alleles_trigger.description: Use additional trigger on variants found in an external alleles file.

use_filtered_reads_for_annotations.description: Use the contamination-filtered read maps for the purposes of annotating variants.

cpu_per_job.description: Number of CPUs to be used per job.

ambig_filter_bases.description: Valid only if \"AmbiguousBaseReadFilter\" is specified:\nThreshold number of ambiguous bases. If null, uses threshold fraction; otherwise, overrides threshold fraction. Cannot be used in conjuction with argument(s) ambig-filter-frac.

ambig_filter_frac.description: Valid only if \"AmbiguousBaseReadFilter\" is specified:\nThreshold fraction of ambiguous bases. Cannot be used in conjuction with argument(s) ambig-filter-bases.

max_fragment_length.description: Valid only if \"FragmentLengthReadFilter\" is specified:\nMaximum length of fragment (insert size).

library.description: Valid only if \"LibraryReadFilter\" is specified:\nName of the library to keep. This argument must be specified at least once. Required. Provide values with comma separated, if multiple.

dont_require_soft_clips_both_ends.description: Valid only if \"OverclippedReadFilter\" is specified:\nAllow a read to be filtered out based on having only 1 soft-clipped block. By default, both ends must have a soft-clipped block, setting this flag requires only 1 soft-clipped block.

filter_too_short.description: Valid only if \"OverclippedReadFilter\" is specified:\nMinimum number of aligned bases.

platform_filter_name.description: Valid only if \"PlatformReadFilter\" is specified:\nPlatform attribute (PL) to match.  This argument must be specified at least once. Required. Provide values with comma separated, if multiple.

black_listed_lanes.description: Valid only if \"PlatformUnitReadFilter\" is specified:\nPlatform unit (PU) to filter out. This argument must be specified at least once. Required. Provide values with comma separated, if multiple.

read_group_black_list.description: Valid only if \"ReadGroupBlackListReadFilter\" is specified:\nThe name of the read group to filter out. This argument must be specified at least once. Required. Provide values with comma separated, if multiple.

keep_read_group.description: Valid only if \"ReadGroupReadFilter\" is specified:\nThe name of the read group to keep. Required.

max_read_length.description: Valid only if \"ReadLengthReadFilter\" is specified:\nKeep only reads with length at most equal to the specified value. Required.

min_read_length.description: Valid only if \"ReadLengthReadFilter\" is specified:\nKeep only reads with length at least equal to the specified value.

read_name.description: Valid only if \"ReadNameReadFilter\" is specified:\nKeep only reads with this read name. Required.

keep_reverse_strand_only.description: Valid only if \"ReadStrandFilter\" is specified:\nKeep only reads on the reverse strand. Required.

sample.description: Valid only if \"SampleReadFilter\" is specified:\nThe name of the sample(s) to keep, filtering out all others. This argument must be specified at least once. Required. Provide values with comma separated, if multiple.

seconds_between_progress_updates.description: Output traversal statistics every time this many seconds elapse.

cpu_per_job_merge.description: This input allows a user to set the desired CPU requirement when running a tool or adding it to a workflow.

compression_level.description: Compression level for all compressed files created (e.g. BAM and VCF).

max_records_in_ram.description: When writing files that need to be sorted, this will specify the number of records stored in RAM before spilling to disk. Increasing this number reduces the number of file handles needed to sort the file, and increases the amount of RAM needed.

memory_overhead_per_job.description: This input allows a user to set the desired overhead memory when running a tool or adding it to a workflow. This amount will be added to the Memory per job in the Memory requirements section but it will not be added to the -Xmx parameter leaving some memory not occupied which can be used as stack memory (-Xmx parameter defines heap memory). This input should be defined in MB (for both the platform part and the -Xmx part if Java tool is wrapped).

memory_per_job.description: This input allows a user to set the desired memory requirement when running a tool or adding it to a workflow. This value should be propagated to the -Xmx parameter too.This input should be defined in MB (for both the platform part and the -Xmx part if Java tool is wrapped).

action.description: Action to take on inputs. Possible values: { CONCAT (the concatenation of all the intervals in all the inputs, no sorting or merging of overlapping/abutting intervals implied. Will result in a possibly unsorted list unless requested otherwise.) UNION (like concatenate but with UNIQUE and SORT implied, the result being the set-wise union of all inputs, with overlapping and abutting intervals merged into one.) INTERSECT (the sorted and merged set of all loci that are contained in all of the inputs.) SUBTRACT (subtracts the intervals in second_input from those in input. The resulting loci are those in input that are not in second_input.) symdiff (results in loci that are in input or second_input but are not in both.) overlaps (outputs the entire intervals from input that have bases which overlap any interval from second_input. Note that this is different than intersect in that each original interval is either emitted in its entirety, or not at all.) }.

break_bands_at_multiples_of.description: If set to a positive value will create a new interval list with the original intervals broken up at integer multiples of this value. Set to 0 to not break up intervals.

cpu_per_job_intervals.description: Number of CPUs to be used per job.

comment.description: One or more lines of comment to add to the header of the output file (as @CO lines in the SAM header).  This argument may be specified 0 or more times. Provide values with comma separated, if multiple.

compression_level_intervals.description: Compression level for all compressed files created (e.g. BAM and VCF).

include_filtered.description: Whether to include filtered variants in the VCF when generating an interval list from VCF.

invert.description: Produce the inverse list of intervals, that is, the regions in the genome that are not covered by any of the input intervals. Will merge abutting intervals first. Output will be sorted.

max_records_in_ram_intervals.description: When writing files that need to be sorted, this will specify the number of records stored in RAM before spilling to disk. Increasing this number reduces the number of file handles needed to sort the file, and increases the amount of RAM needed.

memory_overhead_per_job_intervals.description: This input allows a user to set the desired overhead memory when running a tool or adding it to a workflow. This amount will be added to the Memory per job in the Memory requirements section but it will not be added to the -Xmx parameter leaving some memory not occupied which can be used as stack memory (-Xmx parameter defines heap memory). This input should be defined in MB (for both the platform part and the -Xmx part if Java tool is wrapped).

memory_per_job_intervals.description: This input allows a user to set the desired memory requirement when running a tool or adding it to a workflow. This value should be propagated to the -Xmx parameter too.This input should be defined in MB (for both the platform part and the -Xmx part if Java tool is wrapped).

output_value.description: What value (if anything) to output to stdout (for scripting).

padding.description: The amount to pad each end of the intervals by before other operations are undertaken. Negative numbers are allowed and indicate intervals should be shrunk. Resulting intervals < 0 bases long will be removed. Padding is applied to the interval lists (both INPUT and SECOND_INPUT, if provided) before the ACTION is performed.

scatter_content.description: When scattering with this argument, each of the resultant files will (ideally) have this amount of 'content', which means either base-counts or interval-counts depending on SUBDIVISION_MODE. When provided, overrides SCATTER_COUNT.

scatter_count.description: The number of files into which to scatter the resulting list by locus; in some situations, fewer intervals may be emitted.

sort.description: If true, sort the resulting interval list by coordinate.

subdivision_mode.description: The mode used to scatter the interval list. Possible values: { INTERVAL_SUBDIVISION (scatter the interval list into similarly sized interval lists (by base count), breaking up intervals as needed.) BALANCING_WITHOUT_INTERVAL_SUBDIVISION (scatter the interval list into similarly sized interval lists (by base count), but without breaking up intervals.) BALANCING_WITHOUT_INTERVAL_SUBDIVISION_WITH_OVERFLOW (scatter the interval list into similarly sized interval lists (by base count), but without breaking up intervals. Will overflow current interval list so that the remaining lists will not have too many bases to deal with.) interval_count (scatter the interval list into similarly sized interval lists (by interval count, not by base count). Resulting interval lists will contain similar number of intervals.) }.

unique.description: If true, merge overlapping and adjacent intervals to create a list of unique intervals. Implies SORT=true.

validation_stringency.description: Validation stringency for all SAM files read by this program. Setting stringency to silent can improve performance when processing a bam file in which variable-length data (read, qualities, tags) do not otherwise need to be decoded.

outdir.description: The output directory where the results will be saved. You have to use absolute paths to storage on Cloud infrastructure.
